column4: Hello, I'm having a resolution problem that i actually asked for help here, but i did everything i was told.. and i can't still get to change to 1024x768 resolution. That resolution is shown in xrandr but when i select it all i get is a black space when i scroll down, any ideas? here's my xorg.conf file http://pastebin.com/rPTfrMyt
Does your monitor support higher than 1024x786
I'm trying to set to that resolution, but whenever i do that i can scroll down and see a black space
Open Terminal and do this > sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
i did that, nothing happened...or at least i didn't see anything on the console
Just for verification, what version do you use?
i already did that, but there's no higher resolution than 640x480
Go to System > Administration > Hardware Drivers. Do you see any drivers installed? If so, how many?
I see 3 drivers, one of them is the recommeded one, i'm using that one.. but i also tried the others
Question, do you use a Computer Monitor or a TV as your screen?
